frameDefinitions: This frame characterizes the situation or state of affairs in which someone acts to prevent a Fire_disaster from occurring, accelerating, or affecting any area not identified as a Controlled_area.
This frame describes either the creation of a Flame by a Kindler or non-sentient Cause, or the igniting of Flammables by a Kindler or a Cause.
There is a gradable amount of light in a particular Location.
An Agent creates a Knot (possibly in a Place and/or with an Instrument).'
A Self-moving Escapee departs from an Undesirable_location.
An Agent causes a Fire to no longer burn.
frameExamples: Taliban militants recently <t>set fire</t> to several schools.
The small print was bearly readable by the light of the very <t>dim</t> torch.
Loretta <t>ties</t> the most beautiful bowline I've ever seen.
listRoleDefinitions: The fire that Firefighters target.
The individual or group who respond(s) to the <fen>Fire</fen>.
The time when the Firefighter fights the Fire.
This role identifies the location of the Firefighters as they attempt to fight the Fire.
The <fen>Kindler</fen> is the person performing the intentional act.
The <fen>Flame</fen> is what is created by the Kindler.
The Flamables is the the object that is set on fire by the Kindler.
The cause of the fire.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event takes place.
The place whose amout of light is being described.  The <fen>Location</fen> can also be a location in time, as seen in the second example below:
The entity from which the light eminates.
The Agent is the person performing the intentional act.
The stable configuration of a String which results from tying.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Escapee</fen> manages to leave the <fen>Undesirable_location</fen>.
The <fex name='Undesirable_location'>Undesirable_location</fex> is where the Escapee begins.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the escaping occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the Escaping occurs.
The individual or group that causes the <fen>Fire</fen> to no longer burn.
The combustion process that the <fen>Agent</fen> causes to end.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Fire</fen> goes out.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> puts out the <fen>Fire</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Mark</fex> started the fire with a magnifying glass.
She hid from the man in a dark <fex>corner</fex>.
A dim <fex>lamp</fex> swung over the entrance to the castle.
It took four days before <fex>the fire</fex>was extinguished.
